com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface OMPValidatePlannedRefundUE


  • public interface OMPValidatePlannedRefundUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document validatePlannedRefund(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The OMPValidatePlannedRefundUE user exit is called to validate the planned refund of a payment method.

    • Method Detail

      • validatePlannedRefund

        org.w3c.dom.Document validatePlannedRefund(YFSEnvironment env,
                                           org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException
        The OMPValidatePlannedRefundUE user exit is called to validate the planned refund of a payment method. This can be used to catch malicious activity by a CSR to give an improper refund. If any payment methods are returned from the user exit, an exception will be thrown.
        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: The user exit will be called only when there is a change in PlannedRefundAmount.

        Post-conditions: If any payment methods are returned, they are in violation and an exception will be thrown.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - contains the planned refund information to review. For more information, see the associated input files.


        Returns:
        An XML document that contains a list of payments that have a PlannedRefundAmount too high. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
